title: Globalstar: Connecting the World from Above
description: In this episode, we explore Globalstar, a satellite communications company, and its recent collaboration with Apple to revolutionize emergency communication. Learn how satellite technology is making our world more connected and safer.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Hello and welcome to another episode of 'life is artificial', where we explore the cutting edge of technology, innovation, and what the future could look like.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Today, we’re diving into the fascinating world of satellite communication, focusing on a company called Globalstar. You may not have heard of them, but they are playing a key role in the development of technologies that are literally out of this world—satellites that connect people when the ground-based infrastructure can’t.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: So, what exactly is Globalstar? Well, Globalstar is a satellite telecommunications company that provides voice and data services via a constellation of low earth orbit satellites. These services are particularly useful in remote and rural areas, where traditional cellular networks either struggle or simply don’t exist.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Their services include satellite phones, IoT tracking devices, and emergency communication solutions. Globalstar’s network is made up of 24 low earth orbit satellites, which orbit at around 1,400 kilometers above us. They ensure that, no matter where you are, whether you’re hiking in a remote mountain range or out at sea, there’s a way for you to stay connected.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: But here’s where it gets even more exciting. Recently, Apple committed about $1.5 billion to Globalstar to help expand its satellite capabilities. This is part of Apple's strategy to enhance emergency features in the iPhone, starting with the Emergency SOS via satellite feature that launched in 2022. With this feature, users can send emergency texts even when they’re in locations where there’s no cellular service—essentially turning your iPhone into a lifesaving tool, no matter where you are.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Apple's investment will allow Globalstar to launch new satellites and improve its ground infrastructure. This kind of collaboration shows just how crucial satellite technology is becoming, even in consumer devices. Just think about it—a decade ago, the idea of satellite communication was limited to niche industries or adventure explorers. Now, it's being integrated into mainstream consumer products that millions of people use every day.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: This development also tells us a lot about the future of connectivity. As we continue to build smarter devices and more autonomous systems, our need for constant, reliable communication is only going to grow. And that means more partnerships between tech giants and satellite companies, more infrastructure in the skies above us, and ultimately, a more connected world.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Globalstar is, in many ways, a perfect example of how satellite communication is evolving from specialized industrial applications to something that’s touching everyday life. Whether you’re an outdoor enthusiast looking for safety in remote locations or simply someone who wants peace of mind knowing that emergency help can be accessed even without a cellular network, Globalstar's technology is paving the way.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: And it's not just Apple. Globalstar is working on expanding its reach in other sectors too. They provide services for maritime, aviation, mining, and even government applications—helping ensure that people and assets are connected no matter how challenging the environment. These kinds of solutions are essential for industries operating in remote or harsh conditions where the stakes are high and connectivity is critical.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: So, what can we learn from all of this? Well, for one, the boundaries between our digital lives and the physical world are continuing to blur. Technology is reaching places that were once considered completely out of reach. And it's companies like Globalstar that are making that possible.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Imagine a world where no one is ever truly out of touch—where even in the most remote areas of the planet, there's a satellite overhead ready to connect you. It’s fascinating to see how innovations like these can make our world safer and more connected, and how big players like Apple are recognizing the potential in these partnerships to enhance their own technology.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Well, that’s it for today’s episode. We hope you enjoyed learning about Globalstar and how they’re playing a crucial role in keeping the world connected. If you found this interesting, don’t forget to subscribe and share this episode with others who might enjoy it too.

script.speaker: Host
script.text: Until next time, stay curious, stay connected, and remember—the future is artificial.
